intro: Purdiaea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually blue or violet in color. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes other bellflowers. Purdiaea parvifolia is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in open woodlands and mountainous regions.
